required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Exercise and Weight Control: A Search for Biological and Neurobehavioral Compensatory Mechanisms That Defend Against Exercise-Induced Negative Energy Balance

lead_sponsor.agency: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center

clinical_study.source: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to research the effects of exercise on calories eaten and expended. The investigator expects to find out whether subjects change their eating and activity behaviors when starting an exercise program.

primary_outcome.measure: Negative Energy Balance as assessed by changes in adipose tissue
primary_outcome.description: Whether participants were able to maintain a negative energy balance will be assessed by pre-post changes in stored adipose tissue, as assessed by a dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry scan (DEXA).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in relative reinforcing value (RRV) of food
secondary_outcome.description: RRV of food will be assessed by evaluating the number of responses (mouse button presses) a participant is willing to complete to gain access to food or an alternative sedentary activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average daily calories consumed as assessed by dietary recall
secondary_outcome.description: On two weekdays and one weekend day, participants will fill out the Automated Self-Administered 24-Hour Dietary Recall (ASA24) to estimate dietary intake (total energy, grams carbohydrates, fat, protein, alcohol).

secondary_outcome.measure: Pre-post intervention changes in Ghrelin plasma levels
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will provide a fasting blood sample collected in ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid (EDTA)-coated and serum tubes. Changes in acylated Ghrelin will be measured via enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA).

secondary_outcome.measure: Pre-post intervention changes in glucagon-like peptide 1 (GLP-1) plasma levels
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will provide a fasting blood sample collected in EDTA-coated and serum tubes. Changes in GLP-1 concentrations will be measured via ELISA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pre-post intervention changes in Ghrelin concentrations
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will provide a fasting blood sample collected in EDTA-coated and serum tubes. Changes in Ghrelin concentrations will be measured via ELISA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pre-post intervention changes in irisin concentrations
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will provide a fasting blood sample collected in EDTA-coated and serum tubes. Changes in irisin concentrations will be measured via ELISA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pre-post intervention changes in myostatin plasma levels
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will provide a fasting blood sample collected in EDTA-coated and serum tubes. Changes in myostatin levels will be measured via ELISA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in relative reinforcing value (RRV) of physical activity
secondary_outcome.description: RRV of physical activity will be assessed by evaluating the number of responses (mouse button presses) a subject is willing to complete to gain access to physical activity or a sedentary alternative.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in minutes of sedentary behavior, as assessed by activity tracker
secondary_outcome.description: Minutes of sedentary behavior (non-exercise activity) will be assessed by having participants wear an Actigraph accelerometer for 7 days (minimum 10 hours per day) on the right hip.

arm_group.description: Subjects will be randomly assigned to this group and will exercise energy expenditure of 300 kcal/day.
Subjects will be randomly assigned to this group and will exercise energy expenditure of 600 kcal/day.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 to 40 years old
- BMI of 25.0 - 35 kg/m2
- willing to consent to study conditions
- not taking medications that affects energy expenditure or eating
- not using tobacco or nicotine products
- no food allergies or limitations to eating certain food that would prohibit them from eating the study foods
- not be dieting to lose weight
- no major health problems
- cannot have known cardiovascular, pulmonary or metabolic disease
- cannot be regularly exercising in an aerobic manner more than twice per week
- must have a liking of at least 5 out of 10 for 75% of the study foods
Exclusion Criteria:
- < 18 or > 40 years old
- BMI < 25 or >35 kg/m2
- currently pregnant or trying to become pregnant, or lactating
- currently using tobacco or nicotine
- taking medication that affects energy expenditure or eating
- food allergies to foods used in the study
- regularly exercising in an aerobic manner more than twice per week
- major health problems

facility.name: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Reserach Center

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center
